nidana: Snigdha bhojana vyayama (Exercise after fatty food)
rupa: Sandhi Shula (Severe joint pain, vrishchika damshavat - like a scorpion sting)

samprapti.srotodushti: Sanga (Obstruction), Vimarga Gamanam (Movement in wrong path)

bheda: Not classically defined into types, but severity varies.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Langhana (fasting), Laghu-Ushna-Tikta-Katu dravyas. Avoid Dadhi, Matsya, Masha, Guru Ahara. Use Purana Shali, Yava, Shunthi, Lasuna.
Vihara: Avoid Diva Swapna (day sleep), Sheeta Vayu Sevana (exposure to cold wind). Gentle exercise is advised.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana (with specific oils), Valuka Sveda (sand fomentation), Virechana (Purgation) is the primary Shodhana. Basti (Enema), especially Kshara Basti, is indicated.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara (in Ama Avastha): Langhana (fasting), Deepana-Pachana herbs (Shunthi, Pippali).
Ahara (in Niram Avastha): Peya (gruels), Laghu Ahara. Use Mudga Yusha.
Vihara: Complete rest is essential.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana (Emesis) if Kapha is dominant. Virechana (Purgation) if Pitta is dominant. Basti (Enema) if Vata is dominant. Nasya for headache.

nidana: Kshara-Amla-Lavana Atisevana (Excessive intake of alkaline, sour, salty food)
upashaya: Lauha Bhasma Sevana (Intake of iron preparations)
Rakta Vardhaka Ahara (Blood nourishing diet like Draksha, Dadima)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Deepana-Pachana diet. Use Purana Shali, Mudga, Dadima (Pomegranate), Amalaki, Draksha (Grapes), Ghrita.
Vihara: Rest, avoid excessive exertion and sun exposure.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana (Oleation) with Tikta Ghrita (e.g., Mahatiktaka Ghrita) followed by Virechana (Purgation) is the main line of treatment. Basti is also useful.

nidana: Ati-sevana of Dadhi, Masha, Amla, Lavana
Papa Karma (Classical concept of sinful acts)
upashaya: Tikta Dravya Sevana (Intake of bitter herbs)
anupashaya: Guru, Amla, Dadhi Sevana (Intake of heavy, sour foods, curd)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Sarva Sharira (Whole body, manifests on skin)

bheda: Maha Kushtha (7 types - Kapala, Udumbara, Mandala, etc.)
Kshudra Kushtha (11 types - Eka Kushtha, Charmadala, etc.)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Tikta-Kashaya pradhana. Use Purana Yava, Godhuma, Mudga. Avoid Amla, Lavana, Dadhi, Anupa Mamsa.
Vihara: Avoid exposure to excessive sun and wind.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is the primary treatment. Vamana and Virechana are repeatedly performed. Raktamokshana (especially Siravyadha and Jalauka) is highly indicated. Nasya is also used.

nidana: Gramya-udaka-anupa Rasah (Meat of domestic, aquatic, marshy animals)
purvarupa: Kara-Pada Daha (Burning sensation in hands & feet)
Madhurya in Asya (Sweet taste in mouth)

samprapti.dushya: Meda, Mamsa, Kleda, Vasa, Majja, Lasika, Rasa, Rakta, Oja

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Yava (Barley) is the best. Mudga, Chanaka, Tikta-Shaka (bitter vegetables). Avoid Madhura, Amla, Lavana rasa, Guda, Ikshu.
Vihara: Regular and strenuous Vyayama (exercise).
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana with Tikta Ghrita followed by Vamana and Virechana. Basti, especially Lekhana Basti, is useful for obese patients.

nidana: Atisara Chikitsa Vibhrama (Mishandling of diarrhea treatment)
rupa: Muhur Baddham, Muhur Dravam Malapravritti (Alternating constipation and diarrhea)
Sarvanga Shotha (Generalized edema) in chronic cases

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Takra (buttermilk) is considered nectar. Laghu, Grahi (absorbent) diet like Mudga Yusha, Masura. Use Dadima, Shunthi, Jeeraka.
Vihara: Rest, regular meal times.
chikitsa.shodhana: Generally avoided in weak patients. If patient has strength, Snehapana followed by Virechana. Basti (especially Pichcha Basti) is highly effective.

rupa: Guda Mamsa Ankura (Fleshy growths in the anus)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: High fiber, easily digestible food. Takra is excellent. Use Surana, Haritaki. Avoid spicy, heavy food.
Vihara: Avoid straining, prolonged sitting. Sitz bath (Avagaha Sweda).
chikitsa.shodhana: Bheshaja (Medicine), Kshara Karma (Alkaline cauterization), Agni Karma (Thermal cauterization), and Shastra Karma (Surgery) are the four lines of treatment. Virechana is useful.

purvarupa: Sweda Adhikya / Abhav (Excessive or no sweating)
rupa: Severe Shula (Pain), Daha (Burning), Shotha (Swelling), Raga (Redness) starting from Padamulam (foot) or Hastamulam (hand) and spreading upwards.
upashaya: Sheeta Lepa (Cold poultice for Pitta dominant)

samprapti.udbhavaSthana: Sarva Deha (Whole body), but Rakta is vitiated first

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Purana Yava, Godhuma. Use Ghrita, Milk, Mudga. Avoid Dadhi, Masha, Lavana, Amla.
Vihara: Rest during acute attacks.
chikitsa.shodhana: Raktamokshana (Jalauka - leech is best) is the most important treatment. Virechana and Basti (especially Ksheera Basti) are highly effective.

nidana: Ati Amla-Katu-Vidahi Bhojana (Excess sour, pungent, burning food)
rupa: Hrit-Kantha Daha (Burning in chest and throat)

samprapti.dosha: Pitta (Dravatva guna वृद्धि - increased liquidity), Kapha (Samsarga)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Yava, Godhuma, Mudga, Laja (puffed rice). Use Purana Ghrita, Kushmanda, Patola. Avoid spicy, oily, sour foods.
Vihara: Avoid stress, anger. Regular meals.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana (Emesis) is the best treatment to expel vitiated Pitta and Kapha. Virechana (Purgation) is done after Vamana.

rupa: Asino Labhate Saukhyam (Comfortable in sitting posture)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ushna diet. Yava, Purana Godhuma. Use Shunthi, Pippali, Vasa.
Vihara: Avoid exposure to allergens, dust, smoke, cold. Keep warm.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana (Oleation) and Svedana (Fomentation) are crucial first steps. This is followed by Vamana (Emesis) and Virechana (Purgation).

nidana: Ati Ruksha Anna Sevana (Excess dry food)
purvarupa: Shuka Purna Galaasyata (Sensation of throat being filled with bristles)
rupa: Shiro-Urah-Parshva Shula (Pain in head, chest, flanks while coughing)
upashaya: Madhu-Ghrita Sevana (Intake of honey and ghee)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Ushna, Snigdha, Laghu. Use Godhuma, Mudga Yusha. Honey is excellent.
Vihara: Rest, avoid irritants.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Svedana followed by Vamana or Virechana based on Dosha dominance. Nasya is also beneficial.

purvarupa: Udara Raji Janma (Appearance of lines on abdomen)
anupashaya: Lavana Jala Sevana (Intake of salt and water)

samprapti.dosha: Tridoshaja (Vata is primary cause of distension)
samprapti.agni: Jatharagni Nasha (Severe loss of digestive fire)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Diet restricted to milk, or light gruels. Use Gomutra, Shunthi, Punarnava. Salt is strictly avoided.
Vihara: Complete rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nitya Virechana (daily mild purgation) is the main line of treatment. Basti is also used. Jalodara may require tapping (Siravyadha).

rupa: Hrit Shunya (Feeling of emptiness in heart)

chikitsa.shamana:
Daiva Vyapashraya: Mantra, Japa, Homa (Spiritual therapies).
Yukti Vyapashraya: Medhya Rasayanas (Brahmi, Shankhpushpi), Ghrita Pana.
Sattvavajaya: Ashwasana (Counseling, psychotherapy).
chikitsa.shodhana: Mrudu Shodhana (Mild purification) is key. Snehana with Mahakalyanaka or Panchagavya Ghrita, followed by Mridu Virechana. Nasya and Shirodhara are very effective.

nidana: Ati Ushna-Guru-Kashaya-Tikta Bhojana (Excess hot, heavy, astringent, bitter food)
rupa: Vividha Vedana (Various types of pain in the chest)
upashaya: Vatanulomana Ahara (Diet that moves Vata downwards)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Deepana diet. Use Purana Shali, Mudga, Lasuna, Ardraka. Arjuna is the foremost herb for heart health.
Vihara: Avoid stress, anger, and overexertion. Practice Pranayama.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana for Kaphaja Hridroga. Virechana for Pittaja Hridroga. Hrid Basti (local oil pooling) is highly beneficial. Mridu Shodhana is advised.

sadhyaAsadhyata: Sadhya (if from one route), Asadhya (if from all routes)
nidana: Ati-sevana of Ushna, Tikshna, Kshara, Lavana, Amla food
purvarupa: Ushma (Feeling of heat in the body)
Loha Gandha Nihshwasa (Metallic smell in breath)
rupa: Rakta Srava (Bleeding) from Urdhwa Marga (Nose, Mouth, Ears) or Adho Marga (Anus, Urethra, Vagina)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Sheeta, Tikta, Kashaya rasa. Use Laja, Mudga, Masura, Amlaki, Draksha. Goat's milk is beneficial.
Vihara: Complete rest in a cool place.
chikitsa.shodhana: Line of treatment is Stambhana (hemostasis). But for expulsion of doshas, Virechana is given for Urdhwaga Raktapitta and Vamana for Adhoga Raktapitta.

rupa: Pinda-vat Granthi (A palpable, firm, rounded mass) in the Koshtha

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Deepana diet. Use Lasuna, Hingu, Trikatu, Yavakshara.
Vihara: Avoid suppressing natural urges.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana (Oleation) and Swedana (Fomentation) are primary. Virechana and Asthapana Basti are the main treatments to achieve Vatanulomana.

purvarupa: Hridaya-Nabhi-Guda-Kukshi Toda (Pricking pain in chest, umbilicus, rectum, abdomen)
rupa: Drava Mala Pravritti (Frequent passage of liquid stools)

samprapti.dushya: Ap Dhatu (Liquid portion of body), Purisha

chikitsa.shamana:
First Stage (Amaja): Langhana and Pachana (Fasting & digestives). No Stambhana (anti-diarrheals) should be used.
Second Stage (Nirama): Grahi (absorbent) and Deepana herbs. Takra (Buttermilk) and Dadima (Pomegranate) are excellent.
chikitsa.shodhana: Generally contraindicated. Basti (Pichcha Basti) can be given in chronic conditions once Ama is resolved.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Tikta rasa pradhana. Use Mudga yusha. Complete fasting (Langhana) is very important.
External: Frequent application of cooling and bitter herbal pastes (Lepa).
chikitsa.shodhana: Raktamokshana (Bloodletting) is the most important and immediate treatment. After the acute stage, Virechana (purgation) is performed.

purvarupa: Swapne Madya Pana (Dreaming of drinking alcohol)
rupa: Akasmika Tamah Pravesha (Sudden entry into darkness/loss of consciousness)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Medhya diet. Use Purana Ghrita, Godhuma, Mudga. Garlic and onion are beneficial.
Vihara: Avoid stress, maintain regular sleep schedule.
chikitsa.shodhana: Tikshna Shodhana is required. Snehana with Mahakalyanaka or Panchagavya Ghrita, followed by Vamana, Virechana, and especially Tikshna Shirovirechana (Nasya).

nidana: Pandu rogi tu yo atyartham Pittalani nishevate (A Pandu patient consuming excess Pitta-aggravating foods)
rupa: Haridra Netra-Twak-Nakh-Mutrata (Intense yellow discoloration of eyes, skin, nails, urine)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Tikta-Madhura rasa. Laghu diet. Use Mudga yusha, sugarcane juice, radish. Avoid oily, heavy food.
Vihara: Complete rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Mridu Virechana (mild purgation) with Tikta dravyas is the primary line of treatment. Nasya with Katuki is also indicated.

rupa: Sira Tanutvam (Thinning of skin over veins)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ruksha diet. Use Yava, Kulattha, Mudga. Gomutra is very effective. Salt restriction is key.
Vihara: Avoid day sleep.
chikitsa.shodhana: Virechana is the treatment of choice. Vamana for Kaphotklesha. Niruha Basti is also administered.

purvarupa: Stiffness in low back and leg
rupa: Ruk, Toda, Stambha (Pain, pricking sensation, stiffness) starting from Sphik (buttock) and radiating down the posterior aspect of Kati (low back), Uru (thigh), Janu (knee), Jangha (calf) to Pada (foot).

chikitsa.shamana: Ahara & Vihara: Use Vata-pacifying diet (Snigdha, Ushna, Madhura). Avoid cold and dry foods. Rest is advised in acute stage.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is the primary approach. Snehana (internal and external) and various Swedana procedures. Basti (Enema) is the single most effective treatment. Raktamokshana (Siravyadha) and Agnikarma (cauterization) at specific points are highly effective.

rupa: Eka Paksha Akarmanyata (Loss of function in one half of the body)
Vak Stambha (Slurred speech or loss of speech)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: One side of the body, affecting Urdhwa and Adho Anga (upper and lower limbs)

bheda: No classical types, but severity and prognosis depend on whether it is caused purely by Vata or by Dhatu Kshaya (tissue depletion).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara & Vihara: Brimhana (nourishing) and Vatahara diet. Masha (black gram) is very useful.
Focus on rehabilitation and physiotherapy.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana (both internal and external) and Swedana are performed for a long duration. Basti is the main line of treatment, administered for many days. Nasya is important for cranial nerve involvement.

nidana: Ati Ruksha-Tikshna Aushadha Sevana (Excess dry/strong medicine)
rupa: Dahavat, Sa-Raktam, Sa-Peedam Muhurmuhur Mutra Pravritti (Frequent urination with burning, blood, and pain)
Basti-Medhra-Guda Shula (Pain in bladder, urethra, rectum)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Sheeta veerya, Mutrala diet. Use Yava, Kushmanda, Gokshura, Dhanyaka, Narikela Jala (coconut water). Drink plenty of water.
Vihara: Avoid suppressing urges, excessive intercourse.
chikitsa.shodhana: Swedana (especially Avagaha) is very useful. Uttara Basti (medicated urethral enema) is the specific Shodhana procedure for severe cases.

nidana: Ati Sleshma-Meda Vardhaka Ahara (Excess Kapha and fat aggravating diet)
rupa: Nabhi-Basti-Sevaniya Teevra Shula (Severe pain in umbilicus, bladder, perineum)
Vichhinna Dhara Mutra Pravritti (Interrupted urine stream)

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (forms the stone), Vata (causes pain and obstruction)
samprapti.udbhavaSthana: Basti (Bladder, but can be in kidney - Vrikka)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Mutrala (diuretic) and Ashmari Bhedana (lithotriptic) diet. Use Kulattha, Yava, Gokshura, Varuna, Pashanabheda. Drink plenty of fluids.
Vihara: Avoid suppressing urges.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana, Swedana and Virechana are performed. For large stones not responding to medicine, Shastra Karma (Surgery) is advised by Sushruta.

nidana: Vega Dharana (Suppression of urge to defecate)
rupa: Mala Apravritti / Krichhra Pravritti (Absence or difficult passage of stool)
bheda: Primarily a Vataja condition, can be associated with Pitta (Daha) or Kapha (Gauravam).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Snigdha, Ushna, Drava diet. High fiber foods like fruits and vegetables. Use Ghrita, warm milk, Draksha, Haritaki.
Vihara: Regular meal times, physical activity, avoid suppressing urges.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Swedana followed by Mridu Virechana (mild purgation) is effective. Basti (Anuvasana and Niruha) is the best treatment for chronic Vibandha.

reference: General principles from Charaka/Sushruta (Vatavyadhi, Grahani Chapters)

nidana: Dhuma-Atapa-Raja Sevana (Exposure to smoke, sun, dust)
rupa: Shirasi Vividha Vedana (Various types of pain in the head - throbbing, pricking, burning etc.)
upashaya: Rest in a quiet, dark room

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara & Vihara: Depends on the Dosha. Vataja: warm, oily food. Pittaja: cool, sweet food. Kaphaja: warm, dry food. Avoid triggers.
Local Therapies: Shirolepa (herbal paste on head).
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya is the most important treatment for all types of Shiroroga. Snehana, Swedana, Virechana, and Basti are used based on the Dosha involved.

rupa: Mukhasya Vakrata (Deviation of one side of the face)
Akshi-Bhrū-Kapola-Hanugraha (Inability to move eye, eyebrow, cheek, jaw on one side)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Confined to one side of the face

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara & Vihara: Brimhana (nourishing) and Vatahara diet. Rest and protect face from cold wind.
Local: Mirror exercises for facial muscles.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya is the most effective treatment. Snehana (especially Karna Purana - oil in ears) and Nadi Sweda (local steam) are very important. Mridu Virechana and Basti are also used.

purvarupa: Vedana in Kati, Kukshi, Basti (Pain in low back, abdomen, bladder region)
rupa: Ati Matra, Ati Pravritti of Artava (Excessive amount and frequency of menstrual bleeding)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (causes excess flow), Pitta (causes heat & color change), Kapha (causes stickiness)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Sheeta, Grahi (absorbent), Laghu. Use Tandulodaka (rice water), Mudga, Laja. Avoid sour, pungent, and hot foods.
Vihara: Complete rest is mandatory.
chikitsa.shodhana: Not performed during active bleeding. After bleeding stops, Mridu Shodhana like Virechana can be done. Pichu (vaginal tampon) and Uttara Basti are also used.

rupa: Dhvaja Bhanga (Inability to achieve or sustain an erection)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Brimhana (nourishing) and Vrishya (aphrodisiac) diet. Use Ghrita, Ksheera (milk), Masha, Godhuma, Ashwagandha, Kapikacchu, Musli.
Vihara: Avoid stress, maintain good sleep.
chikitsa.shodhana: Mrudu Virechana followed by Brimhana Basti (nourishing enemas) is the main line of treatment. Vajikarana therapies are employed.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ushna diet. Mudga Yusha. Use Trikatu, Haridra, Tulsi.
Vihara: Rest, stay warm, steam inhalation (Nadi Sweda).
chikitsa.shodhana: In chronic cases (Dushta Pratishyaya), Snehapana followed by Vamana/Virechana. Nasya is very effective.

rupa: Vegavat Vamana (Forceful vomiting of ingested food)

chikitsa.shamana:
Primary treatment is Langhana (fasting).
Ahara: After vomiting stops, give light diet like Laja Manda, Mudga Yusha. Use Ela, Lavanga, Shunthi, Dadima.
Vihara: Rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Virechana is the treatment of choice to pacify the upward movement of doshas.

rupa: Srava (Constant discharge of pus/feces from an opening near the anus)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Creates a track (Nadi) from rectum/anal canal to the perianal skin

chikitsa.shamana: Internal medicines have a limited role, used mainly to control infection and aid healing post-procedure.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is a surgical condition. Shastra Karma (Excision of tract) is one method. However, **Kshara Sutra** (medicated alkaline thread) therapy is the most famous, effective, and minimally invasive Ayurvedic treatment.

sadhyaAsadhyata: Sadhya (as a symptom), Krichra Sadhya (as a disease)
rupa: Teevra Kukshi Vedana (Severe, sharp, colicky pain in the abdomen)
Shwasa Krichrata (Difficulty breathing due to pain)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Langhana (fasting) is the first step. Then give light, warm, carminative food. Use Hingu, Shunthi, Ajamoda, Lasuna. Takra is beneficial.
Vihara: Rest, local warm application.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Swedana followed by Virechana is the main line of treatment. Asthapana Basti with carminative herbs is highly effective.

anupashaya: Punar Bhojana (Eating again before previous meal is digested)
bheda: Vishtabdhajeerna (Vata dominant, with pain and constipation)
Vidagdhajeerna (Pitta dominant, with burning and sour belching)

chikitsa.shamana: Primary treatment is Langhana (fasting) until Agni is restored. Then give Deepana-Pachana herbs (Shunthi, Pippali, Maricha). Drink warm water. Avoid heavy, cold, and fried foods.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana (Emesis) is indicated if Ama is severe and localized in the stomach. Mridu Virechana (mild purgation) can be given after Ama is digested.

nidana: Madhura-Snigdha Ahara (Excess sweet and fatty food)
purvarupa: Kshudra Shwasa (Shortness of breath on exertion)
bheda: Considered a Santarpanottha Vyadhi (disease of over-nutrition).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Guru-Apatarpana (Heavy yet de-nourishing) diet. Use Yava, Kulattha, Mudga. Honey is excellent. Avoid sweets, dairy, fried foods.
Vihara: Regular strenuous exercise, avoid day sleep.
chikitsa.shodhana: Ruksha Udvartana (dry powder massage) is very important. Lekhana Basti (scraping enemas) and Virechana are the main purification procedures.

rupa: Sarvange Kampa (Generalized tremors, especially at rest)
Smriti Kshaya (Cognitive decline in later stages)

samprapti.udbhavaSthana: Pakvashaya (Origin of Vata), manifests in Shiras (Brain)

bheda: Considered a Vataja Nanatmaja Vyadhi (disease caused solely by Vata).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Brimhana and Vatahara diet. Use Masha, Godhuma, Ghrita, milk.
Vihara: Gentle, regular exercise. Avoid stress. Maintain routine.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana (internal/external) and Swedana (Pinda sweda, Nadi sweda) are key. Basti is the most important treatment (Anuvasana and Brimhana Niruha). Shirobasti, Shirodhara, and Nasya are also crucial.

nidana: Sheeta Vayu Sevana (Exposure to cold wind)
rupa: Manya Stambha (Severe stiffness of the neck)
Sometimes associated with Bhrama (vertigo) and Bahu Shosha (emaciation of arm)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Localized to Manya (Sternocleidomastoid region) and Griva (Neck)

chikitsa.shamana: Ahara & Vihara: Vata-pacifying diet. Avoid curd, cold foods. Maintain proper posture. Regular neck exercises (after acute phase).
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya is the treatment of choice. Local Snehana and Nadi Sweda are highly effective. Basti and Virechana can be used for systemic Dosha removal. Greeva Basti (local oil pooling on the neck) is also practiced.

nidana: Sheeta Maruta Samsparsha (Exposure to cold wind)
rupa: Varati Damshtra Sansthanam Shotha (Wheals resembling a wasp sting)
anupashaya: Sheeta Vayu Sparsha (Contact with cold wind)

samprapti.dosha: Vata, Pitta (Samsarga), Kapha (Sthana Sanshraya in Twak)
samprapti.sancharaSthana: Manifests on the skin (Bahya Roga Marga)

bheda: Classified with Udarda and Kotha, which have similar features.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ushna diet. Use Katu-Tikta rasa. Avoid fish, curd, sour foods, and cold items.
Vihara: Avoid exposure to cold wind.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana with pungent oil (Sarshapa taila) followed by Swedana. Vamana and Virechana are effective for expelling the doshas.

purvarupa: Often absent or very subtle skin changes
rupa: Twachi Shweta Mandala (White, non-inflammatory, non-discharging patches on the skin)
Loma Vidhvamsa (Loss of hair over the patches)
bheda: Daruna, Aruna, Kilasa (Based on Dhatu involvement). Prognosis is poor if patches are on palms, soles, lips; hairs on patch are white; and patches have merged.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Avoid all Viruddha Ahara, especially milk with sour or salty items.
Local: Application of Bakuchi (Avalguja) oil/paste and exposure to sunlight is a key therapy.
chikitsa.shodhana: Repeated Shodhana is necessary. Snehana followed by Virechana. Raktamokshana is also important.

rupa: Teevra Karna Vedana (Severe ear pain - throbbing, piercing, etc.)

chikitsa.shamana:
Primary treatment is Karna Purana (instilling medicated oil). Use lukewarm sesame oil, or specific oils.
Vihara: Protect ears from cold wind and water.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya is very effective as it clears the Eustachian tube and head channels. If associated with Pratishyaya, Vamana can be done.

rupa: Vrana (Ulcers) on tongue, gums, palate, inside of cheeks

chikitsa.shamana:
Local: Kavala (Gargling) with Triphala Kwath, Yashtimadhu Kwath. Application of honey or Ghrita.
Ahara: Sheeta, Madhura, Drava diet. Avoid spicy and sour foods.
chikitsa.shodhana: Virechana (purgation) is the best treatment to pacify Pitta systemically. Raktamokshana (Siravyadha from under the tongue) is also advised.

nidana: Nitya Sheeta Jala Sevana in Kapha-prakopa Desha (Living in marshy, cold areas and consuming Kapha-aggravating items)
rupa: Pada-Janu-Uru Shotha (Swelling of foot, knee, thigh which slowly progresses)
Gaja Charma Sadrusham (Skin becomes like an elephant's hide)

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (primary cause of swelling), Vata, Pitta

bheda: Vataja, Pittaja, Kaphaja (Based on symptoms like pain, burning, heaviness)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ruksha, Katu-Tikta diet. Use old grains. Avoid curd, milk, jaggery.
Local: Lepa with pungent herbs.
chikitsa.shodhana: Langhana (fasting) is the first step. Raktamokshana (bloodletting, specifically Siravyadha above the ankle) is the most important treatment. Repeated Virechana and Vamana are also advised.

nidana: Ruksha Ahara Sevana (Consumption of dry foods)
purvarupa: Prasarana-Akunchana Pravritti Sa Vedana (Pain on extension and flexion)

samprapti.dushya: Asthi, Majja, Shleshaka Kapha (Kshaya - depletion of synovial fluid)
samprapti.sancharaSthana: Sandhi (Joints, especially Janu, Kati, Griva - Knee, Hip, Neck)

bheda: Primarily a Dhatu Kshayajanya Vatavyadhi (Vata disorder due to tissue depletion).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-pacifying diet (Snigdha, Ushna, Madhura). Use Godhuma, Masha, Ghrita, Taila.
Vihara: Gentle, non-weight-bearing exercise. Avoid joint overuse. Local Lepa application.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is the cornerstone of management. Abhyanga (oil massage) and Swedana (especially Nadi Sweda, Pinda Sweda). Basti (medicated enema) is the single most important treatment. Janu Basti/Kati Basti are highly effective local procedures.

nidana: Ushnabhitaptasya Jala Praveshat (Entering cold water when body is hot)
Sookshma Nireekshana (Straining eyes on minute objects)
purvarupa: Vyavidha Darshana (Seeing objects as pierced or broken)
rupa: Objects appear hazy or covered in a net/web
Difficulty seeing distant or near objects clearly

samprapti.dosha: Vata, Pitta, Kapha (affecting different layers/Patalas of the eye)
samprapti.dushya: Rakta, Mamsa, Meda of the eye
samprapti.srotas: Urdhwajatru gata Siras (Channels of the head)

bheda: When Doshas affect all layers, it leads to Linganasha (loss of sight/blindness).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Chakshushya (vision-promoting) diet. Use Triphala, Ghrita, Mudga, Draksha, Dadima. Amlaki is excellent.
Vihara: Protect eyes from sun/dust. Regular eye exercises.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana followed by Virechana is the best. Nasya is very important. Netra Kriya Kalpas are the specific treatments: Tarpana, Putapaka, Anjana, Aschyotana.

keyFormulations: Triphala Ghrita (for internal use and Tarpana)

nidana: Kathina Mala Pravritti (Passage of hard stools)
rupa: Gude Karta-vat Vedana (Severe cutting/tearing pain in the anus during and after defecation)
Alpa Rakta Srava (Streaks of bright red blood on stool)
upashaya: Avagaha Sweda (Sitz bath with warm water)
Snigdha Pichu Dharana (Keeping an oily swab)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (causing cutting pain), Pitta (causing burning and bleeding)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: High-fiber, stool-softening diet. Drink plenty of water. Use Ghrita, milk, fruits.
Local: Application of Jatyadi Taila or Ghrita helps in healing. Sitz bath (Avagaha) provides symptomatic relief.
chikitsa.shodhana: Primary aim is Mridu Virechana (mild purgation) to ensure soft stools. Basti (Anuvasana with Jatyadi Taila) promotes healing.

reference: Sushruta Samhita, Chikitsasthana 20 (as a complication of Virechana)

nidana: As a complication of other severe diseases
purvarupa: Kantha-Uras Gauravam (Heaviness in throat and chest)
rupa: Repetitive, involuntary spasm of the diaphragm followed by sudden closure of glottis, producing the characteristic 'hic' sound

chikitsa.shamana:
First line: Ashwasana (reassurance), Pranayama, startling. Give sugar, honey, or Draksha to lick. Use Ela, Lavanga.
Ahara: Laghu diet. Warm water.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Nadi Sweda to chest and neck. Mridu Virechana and Niruha Basti to regulate Vata. Dhumapana (medicated smoking) is also indicated.

samprapti.dosha: Vata (primary for movement and function), Pitta, Kapha

bheda: Based on the four essential factors: Ritu (fertile period), Kshetra (healthy uterus), Ambu (nutrition), Bija (healthy ovum/sperm)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Brimhana and Vrishya diet. Use milk, ghee, Masha, nuts. Shatavari for women, Ashwagandha/Kapikacchu for men.
Vihara: Avoid stress, maintain healthy weight.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is very important to clear the channels. Snehana and Virechana followed by specific Basti courses (Yoga Basti). Uttara Basti is a key procedure for female infertility.

rupa: Bala-Utsaha Kshaya (Severe loss of strength and enthusiasm)

samprapti.agni: Dhatwagni Nasha (Severe impairment of tissue metabolism)

bheda: Considered a complication or advanced stage of Pandu/Kamala.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Madhura, Snigdha, Jeevaniya (life-promoting) diet. Use Draksha, Amlaki, milk, ghee.
Vihara: Complete rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Only Mridu Virechana (mild purgation) with sweet substances like Draksha or Trivrit with milk. Basti (Yapana Basti) is very useful for nourishment.

nidana: Living in specific geographical regions (classical observation of endemic goiter)
rupa: Galasya Parshve Shotha (Swelling on the side of the neck that can be small or large)
bheda: Medoja (Large, soft, oily, with body odor)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Lekhana and Kapha-Vatahara diet. Use old rice, Yava, Kulattha, Shunthi. Avoid milk products, sugar, oily foods.
Local: Lepa with scraping herbs.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana is the main line of treatment. Nasya with pungent oils (Shirovirechana) is also very effective. Siravyadha (venesection) over the swelling is advised by Sushruta.

rupa: Jwara followed by Sphota (Eruptions/pustules) all over the body, resembling Masura (lentil) in shape
bheda: Based on Dosha dominance, affecting the color, shape and symptoms of the eruptions.

chikitsa.shamana:
This is treated like Pitta Jwara.
Ahara: Langhana initially. Then light, cooling, and bitter diet. Mudga yusha, Laja. Avoid salty, sour, pungent foods.
Vihara: Isolation in a clean, airy room. Keep skin clean and dry. Avoid scratching.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated in the acute phase. Mridu Virechana can be given after the fever subsides to clear the residual Pitta.

sadhyaAsadhyata: Sadhya to Asadhya (depending on type and location)
nidana: Nija (Endogenous, e.g., bursting of a swelling)
rupa: Defined by 60 Upakramas (treatment methods) and various classifications. Key features include Srava (discharge), Vedana (pain), Varna (color), Gandha (smell), and the state of the wound margins and floor.

samprapti.dushya: Rakta, Mamsa, Sira, Snayu, Asthi etc.

chikitsa.shamana:
Pathya Ahara is crucial for healing. Diet should be light and nutritious. Avoid Viruddha Ahara.
Shashti Upakrama (60 Methods): This is the detailed management protocol described by Sushruta, including Apatarpana (fasting), Alepa (poultice), Parisheka (washing), Shodhana (cleaning), Ropana (healing), Vaikrutapaham (restoring normalcy).
chikitsa.shodhana: This refers to wound debridement and cleaning as part of the 60 methods, not systemic panchakarma.

rupa: Mala-Mutra-Apana Vayu Sanga (Obstruction of feces, urine, flatus)
bheda: Amaja (Obstruction by Ama in upper GI)
Purishaja (Obstruction by feces in lower GI)

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment is urgent to relieve obstruction.
For Amaja Anaha: Langhana, Pachana, and Vamana.
For Purishaja Anaha: Swedana followed by Virechana and Niruha Basti.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana for Amaja type. Virechana and Basti for Purishaja type are the main lines of treatment.

nidana: Ajeerna Bhojana (Eating before previous meal is digested)
Masha, Pishta Anna (Excess black gram, floury foods)

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (provides breeding ground), Vata (causes pain), Pitta
samprapti.sancharaSthana: Koshtha (GIT), can spread to Rakta etc.

bheda: Abhyantara are of 3 types: Kaphaja (from stomach), Purishaja (from feces), Raktaja (from blood)

chikitsa.shamana:
This disease has a 3-step treatment: 1. Apakarshana (Expulsion), 2. Prakriti Vighata (Altering the environment), 3. Nidana Parivarjana (Avoiding the cause).
Ahara: Katu-Tikta-Kashaya diet. Use Hingu, Vidanga, Ajamoda. Avoid sweets, curd, jaggery.
chikitsa.shodhana: Apakarshana (expulsion) is done via strong Virechana (purgation). Asthapana Basti with Krimi-ghna (anthelmintic) herbs is also used.

samprapti.udbhavaSthana: Localized at the site of affliction

chikitsa.shamana:
In Aama stage: Anti-inflammatory and cooling Lepas. Avoid draining.
In Pakva stage: Treatment is surgical. Shastra Karma (Incision & Drainage) followed by Vrana Shodhana (wound cleaning) and Ropana (healing).
chikitsa.shodhana: This is a surgical condition (Shalya Tantra). Systemic Panchakarma like Virechana or Raktamokshana can be done to support healing and prevent recurrence.

purvarupa: Visual aura (classical texts mention this less)
rupa: Ardha Shirasi Teevra, Ayamyamana, Sphurana-vat Vedana (Severe, expanding, throbbing pain in one half of the head, including eye, eyebrow, temple)
upashaya: Rest in a dark, quiet room

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Confined to one half of the head

chikitsa.shamana:
During attack: Rest. Application of cooling pastes (Chandanadi Lepa).
Preventive: Pathya Ahara (avoiding triggers). Use Ghrita, milk.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya is the most effective therapy. Snehana and Mridu Virechana are very important. Siravyadha (venesection from the temple region) and Lepa are also key treatments.

rupa: Karne Vividha Shabda Shravanam (Hearing various sounds like ringing, buzzing, hissing, etc., in the ear without an external source)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (specifically Prana Vayu affecting sound channels)
samprapti.srotodushti: Atipravritti (of sound perception) / Sanga (obstructing normal function)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-pacifying diet (Snigdha, Ushna). Use Ghrita, milk, Masha.
Vihara: Avoid loud noises, cold exposure.
chikitsa.shodhana: Karna Purana (instilling warm medicated oil) is the main treatment. Nasya and Abhyanga (especially to head, neck, and feet) are very effective. Basti is used for systemic Vata control.

samprapti.dushya: All parts of the eye (Sarvagata Roga)

bheda: Raktaja. It is considered the root cause of almost all eye diseases if left untreated.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu diet. Avoid sour, pungent, salty foods.
Vihara: Rest eyes, protect from light and dust.
Local: Aschyotana (medicated eye drops), Parisheka (washing with Triphala Kwath), Bidalaka (paste application on eyelids).
chikitsa.shodhana: Siravyadha (venesection from forehead/temple) is the most important treatment. Virechana is the best systemic therapy.

nidana: Ishta Vastu Nasha (Loss of a desired object/person)

samprapti.dosha: Vata, Pitta, Kapha (affects mind differently). Manasika doshas: Raja, Tama.

bheda: Based on Dosha dominance, e.g., Vataja (anxiety, fear), Pittaja (anger, irritability), Kaphaja (lethargy, excess sleep).

chikitsa.shamana:
Sattvavajaya (Psychotherapy) is the primary treatment: Ashwasana (counseling), establishing routine, positive social interaction.
Yukti Vyapashraya: Medhya Rasayanas (Brahmi, Shankhpushpi, Jatamansi).
Daiva Vyapashraya: Mantra, meditation.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana (internal/external) with Medhya Ghritas. Shirodhara, Shirobasti are very effective. Nasya and Mridu Virechana help clear the channels.

reference: Charaka Samhita, Sutrasthana 1 & Indriyasthana 6 (as a symptom)

sadhyaAsadhyata: Sadhya to Asadhya (depending on the type)
purvarupa: Pain or discomfort in the pelvic region
rupa: Varies with each of the 20 types. Common symptoms include Yoni Srava (abnormal vaginal discharge), Yoni Shula (pelvic pain), Artava Dusti (menstrual problems), Vandhyatva (infertility).
bheda: 20 types are described, e.g., Vataja, Pittaja, Kaphaja, Udavartini, Putraghni, Paripluta, etc.

chikitsa.shamana:
General: Maintain hygiene. Avoid causative factors. Diet depends on the specific Dosha.
Local: Yoni Dhavana (vaginal douche), Yoni Pichu (medicated tampon), Yoni Dhupana (fumigation).
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Virechana are key. Basti (especially Anuvasana and Uttara Basti) is the most important treatment for most gynecological disorders.

nidana: Krodha, Shoka, Avishvasa (Mother's anger, grief, mistrust)
rupa: Milk becomes phenila (frothy), ruksha (dry), vivarna (discolored), atisnigdha (too oily), etc., based on Dosha. This causes diseases in the infant like Kasa, Atisara, Chardi.

samprapti.dushya: Stanya (Breast Milk, considered an Upa-dhatu of Rasa)

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment is given to the mother.
Ahara: Mother should take light, easily digestible food. Use herbs from milk-purifying groups (Stanya Shodhana Gana).
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana and Virechana are given to the mother based on Dosha dominance to purify the system and subsequently the milk.

rupa: Utsanna, Raga-yukta, Mandala (Elevated, reddish, circular patch)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Twak (Skin), especially in sweaty areas like groin, axilla.

bheda: Considered a type of Kshudra Kushtha (minor skin disease).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Tikta diet. Avoid sweets, curd, oily food.
Local: Lepa (paste application) is the main treatment. Use herbs like Chakramarda, Nimba, Haridra, Gandhaka.
chikitsa.shodhana: Virechana is the best treatment to pacify Pitta and Kapha. Raktamokshana (leech application on the patch) is also very effective.

rupa: Ratrau Nidra Nasha (Inability to sleep at night)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (specifically Prana Vayu), Pitta. Manasika Doshas: Rajas.

bheda: Agantuja (due to external factors like pain, stress)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Snigdha, Madhura, Guru diet at night. Warm milk, ghee, buffalo milk are good.
Vihara: Regular sleep schedule. Abhyanga (full body oil massage), Padabhyanga (foot massage), Shirodhara, Shirobasti are highly effective.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya and Basti are used for chronic cases to pacify Vata at its root.

purvarupa: Manda Vedana in Kati (Mild pain in low back)
rupa: Teevra Vedana in Kati Pradesha (Severe pain in the lumbosacral region)
bheda: Considered a primary Vataja disorder, can have Kapha Anubandha (association with Kapha leading to stiffness).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-pacifying diet (warm, oily, sweet-sour-salty). Avoid dry, cold foods.
Vihara: Avoid forward bending and lifting weights. Maintain correct posture. Local Lepa application.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is the primary treatment. Local Abhyanga and Swedana (Nadi, Patra Pinda). Kati Basti is the most important local procedure. Systemically, Basti (medicated enema) is the best treatment. Virechana and Agnikarma are also used.

nidana: Shoka, Bhaya, Ati Lobha, Krodha (Grief, fear, greed, anger)
rupa: Inability to perceive taste despite a clean tongue

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment focuses on Agni Deepana and clearing the channels.
Ahara: Laghu, Rochaka (appetizing) diet. Use Trikatu, Hingu, Dadima, Amlaki. Takra is beneficial.
Vihara: Maintain pleasant surroundings, cheerful company.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana is the best for Kaphaja Arochaka. Virechana for Pittaja. Basti for Vataja. Kavala (gargling) and Dhumapana (medicated smoking) are also important.

rupa: Nirantara Jala Abhilasha (Constant desire for water, not satiated by drinking)
Talu-Kantha-Oshta Shosha (Dryness of palate, throat, lips)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Cooling and fluid-replenishing diet. Use Laja Manda, fruit juices, milk, sugarcane juice. Ghee is beneficial. Avoid hot, spicy, salty foods.
Local: Kavala/Gandusha with cooling liquids.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated. Treatment is purely Shamana (palliative).

nidana: Visha-Dhuma-Him Sevana (Intake of poison, smoke, cold)
rupa: Vak Apravritti / Krichhra Pravritti (Inability or difficulty in speaking)
Kshama, Karkasha, Ghurghura-yukta Swara (Feeble, rough, gurgling voice)

chikitsa.shamana:
Primary treatment is Mauna (voice rest).
Ahara: Laghu, Ushna diet. Avoid fried, cold, and sour foods.
Local: Kavala (gargling) and Dhumapana (medicated smoking).
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana followed by Mridu Virechana. Nasya is also very useful.

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Can be Bahya (External) or Antar (Internal - in organs like liver, spleen, bladder)

chikitsa.shamana: In Aama Avastha (unripened stage), treatment is like Vranashotha (anti-inflammatory). Once ripened, medical management is insufficient.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is a surgical disease. Treatment for a Pakva (ripened) Vidradhi is Patana Karma (Incision & Drainage), followed by Vrana management (cleaning, dressing, healing).

nidana: Dosha Prakopa in Rakta, Mamsa, Meda

chikitsa.shamana: In early stages, Lepa and Upanaha can be tried. Internal medicines to reduce Kapha and Meda.
chikitsa.shodhana: For Aama (unripened) Granthi, treatment is like Shotha. For Pakva (suppurated) Granthi, treatment is like Vrana. For non-suppurated, developed Granthi, Shastra Karma (Excision) is the main treatment.

purvarupa: Occasional appearance of one or two gray hairs
rupa: Akalaja Kasha Shwetatvam (Premature graying/whitening of hair)

samprapti.srotas: Asthivaha (as hair is Mala of Asthi dhatu)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Pitta-pacifying diet. Use milk, ghee, Amlaki, Bhringaraja. Avoid sour, salty, pungent foods.
Vihara: Avoid stress. Regular sleep. Protect hair from sun.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana followed by Virechana is the best systemic treatment. Nasya is the most important local therapy. Shirolepa and Shiro Abhyanga with cooling oils are also used.

rupa: Akasmat Loma-Shmashru Patanam (Sudden falling of hair from scalp/beard in patches)
Snigdha, Swachha Mandala (Affected area is smooth and shiny)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (causes hair fall), Pitta & Kapha (block the follicles)

chikitsa.shamana: Local: Prachchhanna (scraping) followed by Lepa with hair-growth promoting (Romashanjana) herbs is the primary treatment.
chikitsa.shodhana: Siravyadha (venesection) from the head is the most important therapy. Virechana and Nasya are also performed.

purvarupa: Manda Vedana in Amsa Sandhi (Mild pain in shoulder joint)
rupa: Bahu Praspandita Hara (Loss of movement/stiffness in the arm)
Bahu Shosha (Atrophy of arm muscles in chronic stage)

samprapti.dushya: Sira, Snayu of Amsa Sandhi (Vessels, ligaments/tendons of shoulder)
samprapti.sancharaSthana: Localized to the shoulder and arm

chikitsa.shamana:
Vihara: Gentle, guided physiotherapy after the acute painful stage.
Local: Lepa with pain-relieving herbs.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya is the most effective treatment. Local Snehana (massage) and Swedana (especially Nadi and Pinda Sweda) are crucial. Virechana and Basti are used for systemic Vata control.

rupa: Sarvanga Daha (Burning sensation all over the body)
upashaya: Sheeta Upachara (Cold therapies like applying sandal paste, staying in cool place)
bheda: Based on cause, e.g., Raktaja, Pittaja, Dhatu Kshayaja, Marmaghataja etc.

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment is entirely Sheeta Upachara (cooling).
Ahara: Sweet, bitter, astringent, and cooling foods. Use milk, ghee, Draksha, Dadima. Avoid pungent, sour, salty foods.
Vihara: Rest in a cool place, moonlight exposure, application of Chandana Lepa.
chikitsa.shodhana: Mridu Virechana (mild purgation) with sweet and cooling herbs (like Trivrit with milk or Draksha) is the best treatment. Raktamokshana is also indicated.

rupa: Sukha-Dukha Avyaktata (Inability to perceive pleasure or pain)
Kashta Patanam (Falling to the ground like a log)
Akasmika Tama Pravesha (Sudden loss of consciousness)

samprapti.dosha: Vata, Pitta (Primary). Manasika doshas: Rajas, Tamas.

chikitsa.shamana:
Immediate: Sprinkle cold water, ensure fresh air, use strong fragrances to smell. Once conscious, give Medhya Rasayanas.
Ahara: Laghu, Medhya diet. Use Ghrita, milk, Draksha.
Vihara: Avoid triggers, practice Pranayama and meditation.
chikitsa.shodhana: Mrudu Virechana (mild purgation) is the best treatment. Snehana with Medhya Ghritas (Brahmi Ghrita) is beneficial. Shirodhara and Nasya are also used.

sadhyaAsadhyata: Sadhya (if treated promptly), Asadhya (if complications arise)
nidana: Guru-Ruksha-Sheeta-Dushta Bhojana (Heavy, dry, cold, contaminated food)
rupa: Suchibhiriva Gatra Toda (Severe pricking pain all over the body)
anupashaya: Jala Pana (Drinking water in acute stage)

samprapti.dosha: Tridoshaja (Vata causes severe pain, Pitta causes burning/diarrhea, Kapha causes vomiting)
samprapti.agni: Agni Nasha (Complete loss of digestive fire)

bheda: A type of Ajeerna complication. Closely related to Alasaka and Vilambika.

chikitsa.shamana: This is an emergency. Langhana is the first and foremost treatment. Patient should not eat or drink until Ama is digested. Use Deepana-Pachana herbs like Trikatu, Hingu. After Ama digestion, give light liquids like Peya.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated in the acute phase. Agnikarma (cauterization) at the heels is an emergency measure mentioned in texts.

rupa: Jwara with an irregular or fixed pattern of onset, remission, and relapse (e.g., fever every day, alternate day, every third day, etc.)
Vega-Kala Niyama (Fixed timing of fever spikes)
upashaya: Tikta Dravya Sevana (Intake of bitter herbs)

samprapti.dosha: Vata, Pitta, Kapha get lodged in different Dhatus, causing recurrence when they aggravate.
samprapti.dushya: Rasa, Rakta, Mamsa, Meda, Asthi, Majja, Shukra

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu and Tikta (light and bitter) diet is key. Use old rice, Mudga. Avoid heavy and sweet foods.
Vihara: Rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Shodhana is the best treatment. Snehana with Tikta Ghrita followed by Vamana or Virechana. Asthapana and Anuvasana Basti are highly recommended.

rupa: Basti Shula (Pain in the bladder region)
bheda: 13 types are described, e.g., Vatakundalika (Spasmodic retention), Vatashthila (Prostatic enlargement-like), Mutrajathara (Distended bladder), etc.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Mutrala (diuretic) and Vatanulomana diet. Use Yava, Kulattha, warm water.
Vihara: Avagaha Sweda (sitz bath) is very effective.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Swedana of the bladder region. Uttara Basti (medicated urethral enema) is the specific and most effective treatment. Niruha Basti also helps.

purvarupa: Kshudha Adhikya (Excessive hunger but inability to digest much)
rupa: Dhamani Jala Santata Twak (Skin revealing network of veins)
Bala-Utsaha Hani (Loss of strength and enthusiasm)

samprapti.dushya: Rasa, Rakta, Mamsa, Meda etc. (all dhatus)

bheda: Considered an Apatarpanottha Vyadhi (disease of under-nutrition).

chikitsa.shamana:
This requires Brimhana (Nourishing) therapy.
Ahara: Guru, Snigdha, Madhura diet. Use Navanna (new grains), Godhuma, Masha, milk, ghee, meat soup (Mamsa Rasa), curd, sugarcane.
Vihara: Diva Swapna (Day sleep), lack of worry, pleasant activities.
chikitsa.shodhana: Only Mridu Shodhana (mild purification) with Snehana and Mridu Virechana is done to clear channels. The main line of treatment is Brimhana Basti (nourishing enemas).

rupa: Gradual loss of hair from the scalp, leading to baldness

samprapti.dosha: Pitta (in association with Vata) causes hair fall. Kapha (with Rakta) blocks the follicles, preventing regrowth.

bheda: Based on Dosha dominance, though Pitta is primary.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Keshya (hair-promoting) and Pitta-pacifying diet. Use milk, ghee, Amlaki, Bhringaraja, leafy vegetables.
Vihara: Avoid stress, protect head from direct sun.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana followed by Virechana is the best systemic treatment. Raktamokshana (leech therapy on scalp) can stimulate follicles. Nasya is the most important therapy for all head-related disorders.

purvarupa: Small nodules in the neck region
rupa: Multiple, chain-like, non-painful swellings (Granthi) in the neck, axilla, or groin. They slowly enlarge, suppurate, discharge, and new ones appear nearby.
bheda: Considered a type of Granthi roga.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Lekhana and Kapha-pacifying diet. Use honey, Yava, old grains.
Local: Lepa with scraping and piercing herbs.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana is the main line of treatment. Nasya and Dhumapana are also useful. If medicines fail, Shastra Karma (Excision) or Agnikarma (Thermal Cautery) is performed.

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (Primary, causing itching and oozing), Pitta
samprapti.sancharaSthana: Twak (Skin), especially hands, feet, and flexures

bheda: Considered a type of Kshudra Kushtha.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Tikta-Kashaya (bitter, astringent) diet. Avoid sweets, sour foods, curd, and oily items.
Local: Lepa with drying and healing herbs.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana and Virechana are repeatedly performed. Raktamokshana (Leech therapy) is very effective for reducing itching and oozing.

rupa: Common issues include Garbhini Chardi (Vomiting), Pandu (Anemia), Shotha (Edema), Jwara (Fever), Atisara (Diarrhea), and Rakta Srava (Bleeding/threatened abortion)

samprapti.dosha: Tridoshaja (vitiation depends on cause and symptom)

bheda: Classified by symptom, e.g., Garbhini Chardi, Garbhini Pandu, Garbha Srava (abortion), etc.

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment must be gentle and safe for the fetus.
Ahara: Follow Masanumasika Paricharya (month-wise diet regimen). Generally, a sweet, cooling, and nourishing diet is advised.
Vihara: Avoid all risk factors. Rest and maintain a happy state of mind.
chikitsa.shodhana: All major Shodhana (Panchakarma) are contraindicated in pregnancy, except Basti in the 8th month (Anuvasana Basti).

rupa: Bala-Mamsa Kshaya (Loss of strength and muscle mass)
bheda: Often associated with Phakka Roga (Rickets) and Grahani.

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment focuses on Deepana, Pachana, and Brimhana.
Ahara: Light and digestible food first (gruels), then nourishing foods like milk, ghee, meat soup. Medicated ghee is very important.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated due to the child's low strength. Only very gentle laxatives might be used if needed.

correlation: Disorders from Suppression of Urges / Bloating
nidana: Vega Dharana (Primary cause - suppression of the 13 natural urges like flatus, feces, urine, sneeze, thirst, hunger, sleep, etc.)
rupa: Varies based on the urge suppressed. Common symptoms include Adhmana (bloating), Shula (colicky pain), Mala-Mutra-Vata Sanga (obstruction of feces, urine, flatus), Hridroga (chest discomfort), Shirashula (headache)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (specifically Apana Vayu which then moves upwards - Pratiloma Gati - and vitiates other Vayus)
samprapti.srotas: Purishavaha, Mutravaha, Annavaha (depending on urge suppressed)
samprapti.sancharaSthana: Koshtha (Abdomen) and can affect the entire body

bheda: 13 types, one for each suppressed urge (e.g., Purishaja, Mutraja, Vataja Udavarta).

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment is Vatanulomana (restoring downward flow of Vata).
Ahara: Warm, oily, carminative diet. Use Hingu, Trikatu, Yavani, warm water.
Vihara: Avoid suppressing urges.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is the main treatment. Snehana (internal and external) and Swedana, followed by Virechana (purgation). Basti (Anuvasana and Niruha) is the most effective therapy for correcting the path of Vata.

nidana: Pressing on intestines with feet (classical cause)
purvarupa: Vankshana Shotha (Mild swelling in the groin)
rupa: Vankshana-Phalakoshayo Shotha (Swelling in the groin and scrotum)
Vata Sanchaya (Feeling of air moving in the swelling)

samprapti.srotodushti: Sthana Samshraya (Doshas lodging in the scrotum)

chikitsa.shamana: For all types except Antraja (Hernia) in early stages: Lepa, Bandhana (bandaging), Virechana. Vata-pacifying diet.
chikitsa.shodhana: Antraja Vriddhi (Hernia) is strictly Shastra Sadhya (curable only by surgery). For Mutraja (Hydrocele), aspiration (Vedhana) is done. For ripened inflammatory types, incision is performed. Agnikarma (cautery) is also a treatment modality.

rupa: Ati Kandu (Intense itching, worse at night)
Occurs mainly in Sphik (buttocks), Hasta (hands), and other web spaces
bheda: Considered a type of Kshudra Kushtha.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Tikta rasa pradhana diet. Avoid sweets, sour food, curd.
Local: Abhyanga with Krimi-ghna (anti-parasitic) oils, followed by bath with medicated water. Application of Lepa.
chikitsa.shodhana: Virechana is the best treatment. Raktamokshana is also effective.

rupa: Bahu Sandhi Shula-Shotha (Pain and swelling in multiple joints, especially large ones)
bheda: Considered a severe form or complication of Amavata.

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment must be swift to protect the heart.
First Stage: Langhana and Deepana-Pachana drugs to digest Ama.
Second Stage: Vata-Kapha pacifying medicines. Arjuna is used for cardiac protection.
chikitsa.shodhana: Virechana and Basti are performed only after the Ama and Jwara have subsided.

nidana: Lavana-Amla-Katu-Kshara Bhojana (Salty, sour, pungent, alkaline food)
Riding animals for long duration (causes micro-trauma)
rupa: Teevra Shula, Daha, Raga, Shotha (Severe pain, burning, redness, swelling) starting from small joints (foot/hand) and moving upwards.

samprapti.dosha: Vata (gets obstructed), Rakta (is the primary vitiated dushya)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Avoid aggravating foods. Use old barley, wheat, milk, ghee.
Local: Lepa is very important.
chikitsa.shodhana: Raktamokshana is the single most important therapy (especially with leeches). Virechana and Basti (especially Ksheera Basti) are the main lines of treatment.

nidana: Prasanga (Sexual contact with an infected person - this is a disease described in later texts like Bhavaprakasha, acknowledging its foreign origin)
rupa: Secondary Stage: Twak Vikriti (Skin rashes), Jwara.
Tertiary Stage: Asthi-Majja Vikriti (Deformities of bones, neurological problems), affecting deeper tissues.

chikitsa.shamana:
This disease requires powerful Rasaushadhis. The primary herb used is Chopachini (Madhusnuhi). Purified mercury and sulfur compounds are key.
Ahara: Strict diet is followed. Avoid salt, sour, pungent items.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana followed by Virechana. Raktamokshana is also performed.

purvarupa: Signs of pregnancy (cessation of menses, nausea, etc.)
rupa: Month 2: Ghana (solid mass), pinda (male), peshi (female), or arbuda (neuter).
Month 3: All indriyas (sense organs) and angas (limbs) begin to form.

samprapti.dushya: Development of all Dhatus of the fetus
samprapti.srotas: Rasavaha srotas of mother nourishes the fetus

chikitsa.shamana:
Management is Garbhini Paricharya (Antenatal care).
Ahara & Vihara: Specific diet and lifestyle regimen for each month. E.g., 1st month: sweet, cold, liquid diet (milk). 4th month: milk with butter/ghee. 8th month: medicated gruel with ghee.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated, except Anuvasana Basti in 8th/9th month.

keyFormulations: Month-specific herbal preparations like Madhuka, Ashwagandha, etc.

rupa: Dhanurvat Stambha (Opisthotonus - body bends like a bow)
bheda: A type of Vatavyadhi. If the body bends forward, it's called Abhyantarayama.

chikitsa.shamana: This is an emergency. Patient should be kept in a dark, quiet room. Abhyanga with warm, Vata-pacifying oils. Nadi Sweda (steam fomentation).
chikitsa.shodhana: Basti is the main line of treatment. Nasya with medicated oils is also crucial.

nidana: Snigdha-Sheeta-Guru-Drava Ahara (Oily, cold, heavy, liquid food)
Sama Meda Dushti (Vitiated Ama and Meda)
rupa: Uru Stambha (Stiffness and immobility of the thigh muscles)
Pada Suptata (Numbness and coldness of the legs)
Jangha-Uru Sadana (Extreme weakness of calf and thigh)
The patient's legs feel like they belong to someone else
anupashaya: Snehana, Swedana, Basti (All Panchakarma are contraindicated)

samprapti.dosha: Kapha, Ama, Meda (Primary). Vata is obstructed.

bheda: A unique disease, not classified under Vatavyadhi, as Vata treatment is contraindicated.

chikitsa.shamana:
This is the ONLY line of treatment. Panchakarma is contraindicated.
Ahara: Ruksha, Ushna, Katu-Tikta-Kashaya diet. Use Yava, Kodrava, Shyāmāka. Honey is useful.
Vihara: Udvartana (dry powder massage), walking in sand/dust.
chikitsa.shodhana: All major Shodhana procedures (Vamana, Virechana, Basti) are strictly contraindicated as they can worsen the condition.

nidana: Nitya Sheeta Jala Sevana in Kapha-prakopa Desha (Living in marshy, cold areas and consuming Kapha-aggravating items)
rupa: Pada-Janu-Uru Shotha (Swelling of foot, knee, thigh which slowly progresses)
Gaja Charma Sadrusham (Skin becomes like an elephant's hide)

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (primary cause of swelling), Vata, Pitta

bheda: Vataja, Pittaja, Kaphaja (Based on symptoms like pain, burning, heaviness)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ruksha, Katu-Tikta diet. Use old grains. Avoid curd, milk, jaggery.
Local: Lepa with pungent herbs.
chikitsa.shodhana: Langhana (fasting) is the first step. Raktamokshana (bloodletting, specifically Siravyadha above the ankle) is the most important treatment. Repeated Virechana and Vamana are also advised.

nidana: Ati-sevana of Sneha-Guru-Madhura Ahara (Excess oily, heavy, sweet food)
rupa: Shalmali Kantaka vat Pidaka (Eruptions resembling thorns of Shalmali tree on the face)

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (causes stickiness, blockage), Vata (causes pain), Pitta (causes inflammation, suppuration)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ruksha, Tikta-Kashaya diet. Avoid dairy, sweets, oily and fried foods.
Vihara: Maintain hygiene, avoid stress, regular exercise.
Local: Lepa with Lodhra, Vacha, Dhanyaka, Chandana.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana and Virechana are the best treatments to clear Kapha and Pitta. Raktamokshana (especially with Jalauka - leeches) is highly effective for inflammatory acne. Nasya is also used.

rupa: Chakravat Bhramanam (Sensation of self or surroundings spinning)

samprapti.dosha: Vata, Pitta. Manasika Doshas: Rajas, Tamas.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-Pitta pacifying diet. Use milk, ghee, Draksha, Mudga.
Vihara: Avoid sudden movements, stress. Ensure adequate sleep.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana with Medhya Ghrita, followed by Mridu Virechana. Nasya is a very important treatment. Shirodhara and Shirobasti are highly effective.

reference: Charaka Samhita, Chikitsasthana 26 (as a symptom of various diseases)

rupa: Shotha, Raga, Paka in Talu Moola (Swelling, redness, and suppuration at the root of the palate - tonsils)
Jala-Anna Nigrahane Peeda (Pain on swallowing food/water)
bheda: A specific type of Kantha Roga (throat disease).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ushna diet. Avoid curd, sweets, cold items.
Local: Frequent Kavala (gargling) with warm salt water, Triphala Kwath, or Yashtimadhu Kwath. Dhumapana is also indicated.
chikitsa.shodhana: Raktamokshana (Prachchhanna - scraping over the tonsils) is the first line of treatment. Nasya and Vamana are also used to expel Kapha.

nidana: Upeksha of Pratishyaya (Neglect of common cold)
rupa: Ghana Nasa Srava (Thick, purulent nasal discharge)

samprapti.dushya: Rasa, Rakta, Mamsa of the nasal cavity

bheda: Considered an advanced stage of Pratishyaya, also called Dushta Pratishyaya.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ushna diet. Use Trikatu, Tulsi, Haridra.
Vihara: Avoid cold, dust, allergens. Steam inhalation.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is the main treatment line. Snehana and Swedana of the head region followed by Vamana. Nasya is the most important therapy, administered for several days.

rupa: Smriti Bhramsha (Loss of memory - recent or remote)
bheda: Can be a symptom of other diseases like Unmada, Apasmara or a separate entity.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Medhya (intellect-promoting) and nourishing diet. Use milk, ghee, almonds, walnuts.
Vihara: Regular sleep, mental exercises, meditation, Pranayama.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana with Medhya Ghritas (Brahmi Ghrita, Mahakalyanaka Ghrita). Mridu Virechana and Nasya are very effective. Shirodhara and Shirobasti are the choice of therapies.

rupa: Kharasparsha, Kathina, Shyava Varna, Keela Sadrusha Pidaka (Rough, hard, blackish, nail-like elevations on the skin)
bheda: Kaphaja (Smooth, same color as skin, less pain)

chikitsa.shamana: Local: Application of Kshara (caustic alkalis) like Apamarga Kshara or latex of Snuhi is the primary treatment.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is a Shalya (surgical) condition. Shastra Karma (Excision), Kshara Karma (Chemical Cautery), and Agnikarma (Thermal Cautery) are the definitive treatments. Raktamokshana is also advised.

rupa: Pada Tale Darana (Fissures/cracks on the soles and heels)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (causes dryness and cracks), Pitta (causes burning and bleeding)

bheda: Considered a Vataja Kshudra Roga (minor disease of Vata).

chikitsa.shamana:
Local treatment is key. Frequent Snehana (oleation with medicated oils/ghee) and Swedana (fomentation). Application of Siktha Taila (beeswax-based ointments).
Vihara: Wear soft footwear, avoid walking barefoot.
chikitsa.shodhana: Sarvanga Abhyanga (full body massage) and Basti are useful for systemic Vata pacification in severe, chronic cases.

purvarupa: Kati-Kukshi Gauravam (Heaviness in low back and abdomen) before menses
rupa: Artava Kale Teevra Vedana (Severe pain during menstruation in lower abdomen, low back, thighs)
Phenila, Tanu, Krishna Artava (Frothy, thin, blackish discharge)
bheda: A type of Yonivyapad (gynecological disorder), specifically Udavartini Yonivyapad.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-pacifying diet, especially before and during menses. Use Tila (sesame), Kulattha, Hingu, warm water.
Vihara: Avoid stress and exertion during menses. Apply warm castor oil packs.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Virechana are performed during the inter-menstrual period. Basti is the most important treatment, especially Anuvasana Basti with Dhanwantaram Thailam and Niruha Basti.

nidana: Upeksha of Timira (Neglect of early vision defects)
rupa: Drishti Mandalam Ghana-Prakasha-Asaham (Pupil becomes opaque, dense, and intolerant to light)
Roopa Grahana Akshamata (Inability to perceive shapes/vision)
The pupil appears white, cloudy, or discolored.

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (causes opacity), Pitta, Vata. The Doshas solidify in the Drishti Mandala (lens).

bheda: Considered the final, incurable (by medicine) stage of Timira. 6 types based on Dosha and color of pupil.

chikitsa.shamana: Medical management is ineffective once Linganasha is fully developed. Treatments are aimed at preventing the progression from Timira.
chikitsa.shodhana: Sushruta described a detailed Shastra Karma (Surgical Procedure) for this condition, which is a historical precursor to modern cataract surgery. Post-operative care (Paschat Karma) is crucial.

keyFormulations: Post-surgically, eye-soothing (Chakshushya) herbs and procedures like Tarpana are used.

rupa: Prabhuta, Achchha, Sheeta, Nirgandha Mutra Pravritti (Frequent passage of large amounts of clear, cool, odorless urine, similar to water)

samprapti.dosha: Vata (controls excretion), Kapha (related to fluid quality)

bheda: Can be a symptom of Vataja Prameha (Udakameha), but also considered a separate entity.

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment is Brimhana (nourishing) and Grahi (absorbent/astringent).
Ahara: Use Masha, Godhuma, milk, ghee, meat soup. Avoid excessive liquids.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated due to the Dhatu Kshaya state. Only nourishing Basti (Yapana Basti) can be considered.

purvarupa: Stiffness and mild pain in the knee joint
rupa: Janu Sandhi Shotha (Swelling of the knee joint) resembling the head of a jackal (Kroshtuka Shirsha)
bheda: A specific type of Vata-Rakta or Sandhigata Roga.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-Pitta pacifying diet. Use milk, ghee, Tikta rasa dravyas.
Vihara: Complete rest is advised. Local application of pain-relieving Lepas.
chikitsa.shodhana: Raktamokshana (Leech therapy or Siravyadha) is the primary line of treatment. After inflammation subsides, Virechana and Basti are performed. Janu Basti is very effective.

purvarupa: Mild stiffness or clicking sound in the jaw
rupa: Mukha Vivrita Asamata (Inability to open the mouth properly)
Vedana in Hanu Sandhi (Pain in the temporomandibular joint)

samprapti.dushya: Sira, Snayu of Hanu Sandhi (Vessels, Ligaments of TMJ)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Soft, liquid, or semi-solid diet that requires minimal chewing.
Vihara: Avoid excessive talking, yawning, or chewing.
chikitsa.shodhana: Local Snehana (oleation) and Nadi Sweda (steam fomentation) is the primary treatment. Nasya Karma is highly effective. Basti is used for systemic Vata control.

keyFormulations: Ksheerabala Tailam (for Nasya and local massage)

nidana: Guda Ashaucha (Improper cleaning of anal region)
Mutra-Purisha Samsparsha (Prolonged contact with urine and feces)
purvarupa: Slight redness and itching in the anal region
rupa: Rakta Pidaka (Red papules/eruptions) around the Guda (anus)
Sometimes forms a single confluent ulcer
bheda: A type of Kshudra Roga, specific to infants.

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment of the mother and child. Mother's milk should be purified (Stanya Shodhana).
Local: Keep the area clean and dry. Frequent washing with Triphala or Nimba Kwath. Application of healing (Ropana) powders like Yashada Bhasma or oils like Jatyadi Taila.
chikitsa.shodhana: Not applicable to the infant. Mild purgatives may be given to the mother.

rupa: Vama Parshve Udara Vriddhi (Abdominal enlargement, predominantly on the left side)

samprapti.agni: Jatharagni Nasha (Severe loss of digestive fire)

bheda: A specific type of Udara Roga (abdominal disease).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Light diet restricted to milk or gruel. Use Pippali, Shunthi, Gomutra.
Vihara: Complete rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nitya Virechana (daily mild purgation) is the main treatment. Siravyadha (venesection from the left arm) is specifically indicated. Agnikarma (thermal cautery) over the spleen area is also advised.

nidana: Upeksha of Karna Shula (Neglect of earache)
Jala Pravesha (Entry of water leading to infection)
rupa: Karnat Pooya Srava (Discharge of pus from the ear - can be thin, thick, yellow, or foul-smelling based on Dosha)

samprapti.dosha: Kapha (thick discharge), Pitta (yellow, foul discharge), Vata (thin discharge)

bheda: Considered a separate Karna Roga (ear disease).

chikitsa.shamana: Local treatment is primary. Karna Dhavana (cleaning the ear with medicated liquids). Karna Dhupana (fumigation with Guggulu, Vacha etc.). Then, Karna Purana (instilling medicated drops) with antimicrobial oils.
chikitsa.shodhana: Vamana and Nasya are performed to clear the Kapha from the head and neck region.

nidana: Mano Dosha (Vitiation of Rajas and Tamas)
Dhee-Dhriti-Smriti Vibhramsha (Derangement of intellect, courage, memory)
Asatmya Indriyartha Samyoga (Improper use of sense organs)
rupa: Viparita Abhinivesha (Stubbornly perceiving things opposite to reality)
Adherence to false beliefs despite proof
Can manifest as obsession, paranoia, or delusion

samprapti.dosha: Manasika Doshas (Rajas, Tamas), Tridoshaja (affecting the mind)

chikitsa.shamana:
Sattvavajaya (Psychotherapy) is the cornerstone. Counseling, reassurance, Jnana (imparting knowledge), Vijnana (specific analysis).
Yukti Vyapashraya: Use of Medhya (intellect-promoting) herbs and Ghritas.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana with Mahakalyanaka or Panchagavya Ghrita. Shodhana (Vamana, Virechana, Basti, Nasya) is very important to clear the channels. Shirodhara is highly beneficial.

rupa: Kashta-pashana-vat Patati (Falls down like a log or stone)
Chesta-Sanjna-Kshaya (Complete loss of motor and sensory functions)
upashaya: Tikshna Aushadhi Prayoga (Application of very strong/sharp medicines)

samprapti.dosha: Sannipataja (Severe aggravation of all three Doshas)

bheda: The most severe and final stage of consciousness loss, beyond Mada and Murchha.

chikitsa.shamana:
This is a medical emergency. Immediate and strong measures are taken to revive consciousness.
Actions: Tikshna Anjana (strong collyrium), Tikshna Nasya (strong errhines like Katphala churna), Suchi Todana (pricking with needles), Dhumapana (strong fumigation).
chikitsa.shodhana: Not applicable in the acute comatose state.

keyFormulations: Any strong pungent/sharp substance to stimulate senses.

purvarupa: Inadequate growth of uterus as per gestational age
rupa: Garbhasya Akalpavriddhi (Fetus does not grow properly)
The delivered child is weak, emaciated, and has low immunity
bheda: A specific Garbhini Vyapad (disease of pregnancy).

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment is given to the mother. Brimhana (nourishing) and Vata-pacifying therapy is essential.
Ahara: Mother should consume milk, ghee, meat soup (Mamsa Rasa), eggs, and other nourishing foods.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated. Only nourishing Basti (Yapana Basti) with milk and ghee can be administered.

nidana: Sheeta-Ushna Ahara-Pana (Excessive cold/hot food and drinks)
rupa: Teevra Vedana in Danta (Severe pain in a tooth)
Shotha in Dantamula (Swelling of the gums)
Pain may radiate to head, ear, or jaw
upashaya: Holding warm oil/decoction in the mouth
anupashaya: Exposure to cold or hot substances

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Localized to the tooth and surrounding structures

bheda: A type of Danta Roga (dental disease).

chikitsa.shamana: Local treatment is primary. Kavala/Gandusha (gargling/oil pulling) with warm sesame oil, or decoctions of Vata-pacifying herbs. Placing a cotton swab soaked in Lavanga Taila (clove oil) is effective. Dhumapana (medicated smoking) is also advised.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya is useful for pain relief. For Krimidanta (caries), extraction (Dantoddharana) is the final option as per classics.

nidana: Guru-Snigdha-Sheeta Bhojana (Very heavy, oily, cold food)
rupa: Doshas obstruct food, preventing upward (vomiting) or downward (diarrhea) movement
Utklishta Doshas (Doshas are severely aggravated but immobile)
The patient is lethargic and listless (Alasa)

samprapti.agni: Agni Nasha (Complete loss of digestive fire)

bheda: A severe, deadly complication of Ajeerna, related to Visuchika.

chikitsa.shamana: This is a medical emergency. Langhana (absolute fasting) is crucial. Swedana (fomentation) of the abdomen. A Varti (suppository) is inserted to induce purgation. Patient should be kept warm.
chikitsa.shodhana: Inducing Vamana (emesis) and Virechana (purgation) with very strong medicines is the only line of treatment to clear the obstruction.

keyFormulations: Ichhabhedi Rasa (with extreme caution by a physician)

rupa: Teevra, Bhedana-vat Shula (Severe, piercing pain) in Manya (Nape of neck), Griva (Neck), extending to Ganda (Cheek) and Akshi (Eye)

samprapti.dushya: Rakta, Sira of the head region

bheda: A specific type of Shiroroga (head disease).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-Pitta pacifying diet. Use ghee, milk, warm foods.
Vihara: Protect head and neck from cold wind.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Nadi Sweda (local steam) are crucial. Siravyadha (venesection from the forehead) is advised. Nasya is the most important treatment. Basti is used for systemic Vata control.

sadhyaAsadhyata: Asadhya (if not treated immediately, leads to blindness)
rupa: Netre Nirmadhyamana-iva Teevra Vedana (Excruciating pain as if the eye is being churned or plucked out)
Pain radiating to half of the head
Rapid and severe loss of vision

samprapti.dosha: Tridoshaja (Vata causes pain, Pitta causes burning, Kapha causes swelling)
samprapti.srotodushti: Ati Pravritti, Sanga (causing severe obstruction and pressure)
samprapti.sancharaSthana: Entire eye and related channels in the head

bheda: Vataja, Pittaja, Kaphaja, Raktaja. All forms are considered emergencies.

chikitsa.shamana:
Limited role. Used after aggressive Shodhana.
Local: Aschyotana (eye drops), Lepa over eyelids.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is a medical emergency. Immediate Siravyadha (venesection from forehead/temple) is the most critical life-saving (for vision) treatment. This is followed by Virechana (purgation). Nasya is also important.

correlation: Hematometra / Abdominal mass due to menstrual obstruction
nidana: Suppression of menstrual flow (Artava Vega Dharana)
Vata aggravating factors immediately after miscarriage or delivery
rupa: Symptoms of pregnancy like nausea, breast changes, but no fetal movement (Spandana-rahita)
Pain, burning, and discomfort in the lower abdomen
bheda: A specific type of Gulma found only in females.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vatanulomana and Rakta Prasadaka (blood purifying) diet. Use Kulattha, Tila Taila, Lasuna.
Vihara: Avoid suppressing urges.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehapana with Vata-pacifying oils/ghee followed by Virechana. Asthapana and Anuvasana Basti are the main treatments. Yoni Pichu (vaginal tampon) with medicated oils is also used.

nidana: Vata Prakopa immediately after delivery (due to empty space - Rikta Sthana)
Retained blood clots (Rakta Sanga) in the uterus
purvarupa: Mild discomfort in the lower abdomen after delivery
rupa: Teevra Nabhi-Basti-Udara Shula (Severe pain in umbilical, bladder, and abdominal regions) after childbirth

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Warm, light, and easily digestible diet. Use Pippali, Shunthi, Hingu. Drinking warm water is beneficial.
Vihara: Abdominal binding, rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Not applicable. Treatment is purely Shamana. The goal is Vatanulomana (downward movement of Vata) and Garbhashaya Shodhana (cleansing of uterus).

nidana: Kapha-Vata Prakopaka Nidanas for the infant
rupa: Talu Nimnata (Depression of the soft palate / fontanelle)

chikitsa.shamana:
Primary treatment is rehydration and nourishment. Frequent breastfeeding. If mother's milk is insufficient, give goat's milk.
Procedure: Gently lift the palate (Talu Utkshepana) with an oily finger while nourishing the child.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated in infants.

purvarupa: Recurrent episodes of indigestion and diarrhea
rupa: Muhur Baddham, Muhur Dravam Mala (Alternating constipation and loose stools)
Apakva, Durgandhita Mala (Stool with undigested food and foul smell)
bheda: The pediatric presentation of Grahani Roga.

chikitsa.shamana: Focus is on Agni Deepana and Brimhana. First, use Deepana-Pachana drugs. Takra (buttermilk) is the best medicine. Give light-to-digest gruels. Medicated ghee is very useful.
chikitsa.shodhana: Not advisable. Only very gentle procedures like Pichcha Basti can be considered in chronic cases by an expert.

rupa: Pani-Pada Sphutanam (Fissuring and cracking of skin on palms and soles)
bheda: A type of Kshudra Kushtha (minor skin disease).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vata-Kapha pacifying diet, avoid irritants.
Local: Frequent oleation with medicated oils/ghee. Application of healing pastes. Soaking hands/feet in medicated decoctions.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehapana followed by Virechana. Raktamokshana (leech therapy) is very effective to relieve pain and itching.

rupa: Jala-purna, Agni-dagdha-vat Sphota (Large, fluid-filled blisters resembling burns)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Sarvanga Twak (Skin of the whole body)

bheda: A specific skin disease, often described along with Masurika.

chikitsa.shamana:
Treated on the lines of Pitta-Rakta disorders.
Ahara: Laghu, Sheeta, Tikta diet. Avoid sour, salty, pungent foods.
Local: Washing with Nimba/Triphala Kwath. Application of cooling pastes.
chikitsa.shodhana: Virechana (purgation) is the main line of treatment. Raktamokshana is also highly indicated.

nidana: Dhatu Kshaya (especially due to old age)
rupa: Asthi Bheda-vat Shula (Splitting pain in bones)
Kesha-Loma-Nakha-Danta Patanam (Falling of hair, nails, teeth)
bheda: A specific type of Gambhira Vatavyadhi (deep-seated Vata disorder).

chikitsa.shamana: Ahara: Brimhana (nourishing) diet rich in sweet and bitter tastes. Milk, ghee, and meat soup are highly recommended (Tikta-Ksheera Basti).
chikitsa.shodhana: Basti is the primary treatment. Anuvasana (oil enema) and Niruha (decoction enema), especially with Tikta dravyas (bitter herbs) and Ksheera (milk), is the specific line of treatment.

rupa: Akasmat Danta Mamshebhyo Rakta Srava (Spontaneous bleeding from the gums)
Danta Chalana (Loosening of teeth in chronic stage)
bheda: A type of Danta Mula Gata Roga (disease of the gums).

chikitsa.shamana:
Local hygiene is most important. Kavala/Gandusha (gargling/oil pulling) with decoctions of astringent herbs or with medicated oils.
Procedure: Pratisarana (rubbing powders on the gums).
chikitsa.shodhana: Raktamokshana (bloodletting) from the gums using leeches (Jalauka) or by scarification is the primary treatment. Nasya is also beneficial.

nidana: Sheeta Jala Sparsha (Contact with cold water)
rupa: Danta Sparsha Akshamata (Inability to tolerate contact with cold, hot, sour, or even wind)
Sensation of teeth being set on edge
upashaya: Holding warm, oily liquids in the mouth (Gandusha)
anupashaya: Sheeta, Amla Guna (Cold and sour substances)
bheda: A specific type of Danta Roga (dental disease).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Avoid extremely hot, cold, and sour foods. Use Vata-pacifying diet.
Local: Gandusha (oil pulling) with lukewarm sesame oil or Dhanwantaram Thailam. Applying paste of Tila (sesame) and milk.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nasya with Vata-pacifying oils like Ksheerabala Tailam is the primary line of treatment to pacify Vata in the head region.

keyFormulations: Yashtimadhu Churna (mixed with honey for application)

nidana: Abhighata (Trauma to the floor of the mouth)
rupa: Jihwa-tala Shotha (Swelling under the tongue) resembling a long blister
bheda: A specific type of Jihwa Roga (tongue disease).

chikitsa.shamana: Local: Lekhana (scraping) followed by Pratisarana (rubbing) with powders of Trikatu, Yavaksara etc.
chikitsa.shodhana: This is treated surgically. Raktamokshana (bloodletting) by scarification is the first step. If it recurs, Shastra Karma (Excision) and Agnikarma (Thermal Cautery) are performed. Vamana and Nasya are also used to clear Kapha.

rupa: Hasta-Pada-Jangha-Uru Pradesh Sankocha (Sudden, painful, involuntary contraction of muscles in hands, feet, calves, or thighs)

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Warm, oily, and nourishing (Brimhana) diet. Use milk, ghee, and Masha (black gram).
Vihara: Immediate application of heat and massage to the affected area.
chikitsa.shodhana: Regular Abhyanga (oil massage) is preventive. For recurrent cramps, Virechana and Basti are the main treatments to pacify Vata systemically.

purvarupa: Mild discomfort in the chest wall
rupa: Suchibhiriva Toda in Parshva (Sharp, pricking, needle-like pain in the flanks/chest wall)
Pain aggravates during Shwasa-Prashwasa (inspiration/expiration), Kasa (coughing), Jrimbha (yawning)

samprapti.dushya: Rasa, Mamsa of the chest wall

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Laghu, Ushna, Vatanulomana diet. Use Pippali, Shunthi.
Vihara: Rest. Local application of warm analgesic oils.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana followed by Virechana is the best treatment. Niruha Basti is also administered. In some cases, Siravyadha (venesection) from the intercostal space is advised.

reference: Charaka Samhita, Chikitsasthana 11 (as a symptom of Shotha)

rupa: Dakshina Parshve Udara Vriddhi (Abdominal enlargement, predominantly on the right side)
bheda: A specific type of Udara Roga. Often clubbed with Plihodara.

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Primarily a milk diet (Ksheera Prayoga). Use Tikta rasa dravyas like Katuki, Bhumyamalaki.
Vihara: Complete rest.
chikitsa.shodhana: Nitya Mridu Virechana (daily mild purgation) is the main line of treatment. Siravyadha (venesection from the right arm) is specifically indicated.

rupa: Basti Adho Sthira, Unnata, Ashthila-vat Granthi (A fixed, elevated, stone-like mass below the bladder)
Mutra-Vata-Shakrit Sanga (Obstruction of urine, flatus, and feces)
bheda: A specific type of Mutraghata (urinary obstruction).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Vatanulomana diet. Use warm water, Yava, Kulattha.
Vihara: Regular Avagaha Sweda (sitz bath) is very helpful.
chikitsa.shodhana: Snehana and Swedana of the pelvic region. Virechana and Niruha Basti are administered. Uttara Basti is the specific treatment.

nidana: Krodha, Shoka, Avatsalya (Mother's anger, grief, lack of affection for child)
rupa: Alpa Stanya Pravritti / Apravritti (Scanty or no secretion of breast milk)
The child remains unsatisfied and cries frequently

chikitsa.shamana:
Treatment is given to the mother.
Ahara: Brimhana (nourishing) and Stanyajanana (galactagogue) diet. Use Ksheera (milk), Lasuna (garlic), Shatavari, Jeevanti, Mudga, Yava, Godhuma.
chikitsa.shodhana: Contraindicated. Treatment is purely nourishing.

nidana: Ati-sevana of Dadhi, Masha, Amla, Lavana
rupa: Shyava, Kinakharasparsham, Parusham Mandala (Blackish-brown, rough, hard, well-demarcated patches)

samprapti.sancharaSthana: Twak (Skin), especially over joints like elbow and knee

bheda: A type of Kshudra Kushtha (minor skin disease).

chikitsa.shamana:
Ahara: Avoid Kapha-Vata aggravating foods.
Local: Frequent application of medicated oils to counter dryness.
chikitsa.shodhana: Repeated Shodhana is the key to management. Snehapana (internal oleation with medicated ghee) for several days followed by Vamana and Virechana. Takradhara is also beneficial.

nidana: Ati-sevana of Ushna, Tikshna, Kshara, Lavana, Amla food
rupa: Rakta Srava from Urdhwa Marga (Bleeding from nose, mouth, ears, eyes)
The blood is often bright red and frothy (Kapha Anubandha)
